sentences.sContent: Employees must show their identity cards at the gate.
sentences.sCn: 雇员在大门口必须出示自己的身份卡。

sentences.sContent: I haven’t got my membership card yet.
...his wife could not have taken out a loan or a credit card in her own name...
...which could have loss implications for the credit card issuing banks...
...A new study out of Ohio State University found that young adults are accumulating credit card debt at a more rapid rate than other age groups...
...Dunn says a lot of these young people are never going to get out from under their credit card debt...
...it's a safe bet that these young adults are paying relatively high interest rates on the resulting credit card debt...
...Many people are borrowing on credit cards so heavily that payoff rates at these levels are not sufficient to recover their credit card debt by the end of their life...

...Someday a stranger will read your e-mail without your permission or scan the Website you've visited，Or perhaps someone will casually glance through your credit card purchases or cell phone bills to find out your shopping preferences or calling habits...
...Especially if they flashed a card to you...

phrases.pCn: （美）绿卡（指允许外国人进入美国工作的绿色许可证）；（英）绿色保险证

trans.tranOther: a small piece of plastic or paper containing information about a person or showing, for example, that they belong to a particular organization, club etc
